alert.note: Alert for Northern Carbon; Northern Stillwater; Southwestern Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 6:17PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Stillwater, north central Carbon and southwestern Yellowstone Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 613 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles west of Laurel to 6 miles north of Pryor. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Erratic wind gusts to 45 mph, brief heavy rain and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Localized street flooding is possible due to heavy rainfall. Locations impacted include... Billings, Laurel, Lockwood, Huntley, Shepherd, Billings Heights, Billings West End, Pryor, Edgar, Silesia, Acton, Park City and Rockvale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northern Carbon; Northern Stillwater; Southwestern Yellowstone
